question.title: trying to import multiple projects into eclipse on Linux that used to be on Windows
question.body:
I have dozens of Java projects that I worked on in eclipse in Windows 10 (and earlier versions). I am changing my home setup to ubuntu, so I copied the entire workspaces tree over to the ubuntu machine. For a couple of projects I have used File / Import for "existing project into workspace" without trouble; after I imported, I was able to see all the source files in the workspace navigator view, edit them, run the program, etc.

The two projects that I imported without trouble were imported "in place", that is, I imported them into the workspace and left all their files in the directories where they already existed.

Now I've run into one that I'm having trouble importing, called ShowPath. The projects that imported correctly were all in the same workspaces directory, /home/xfirstname/programming/workspaces/ and then each in their own xprojectname subdirectory under that. This new one is in the same workspaces directory but in an /xlastname/ShowPath subdirectory instead of just ShowPath.

When I use File / Import as I have before, I see the dialog that shows the ShowPath project in that directory. I leave all the checkboxes unchecked (search for nested, copy, close, hide, and add to working sets) and click finish. I get the message: "Some projects cannot be imported because they already exist in the workspace or their project file is corrupted."

The .project file has:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>  
<projectDescription>  
    <name>ShowPath</name>  
    <comment></comment>  
    <projects>  
    </projects>  
    <buildSpec>  
        <buildCommand>  
            <name>org.eclipse.jdt.core.javabuilder</name>  
            <arguments>  
            </arguments>  
        </buildCommand>  
    </buildSpec>  
    <natures>  
        <nature>org.eclipse.jdt.core.javanature</nature>  
    </natures>  
</projectDescription>

When I click on the "Details" button on the error dialog, it shows:

Invalid project description for project 'ShowPath' at 'file:/home/xfirstname/programming/workspaces/xlastname/ShowPath' /home/xfirstname/programming/workspaces/xlastname/ShowPath overlaps the workspace location /home/xfirstname/programming/workspaces/xlastname/ShowPath

Well, I know they overlap; I'm trying to import this project while leaving it in the directory tree where all its files are. I thought this is what I did for the other existing eclipse projects when it did work, I don't understand what I'm doing wrong (or differently) here.

I have tried clicking the "Refresh" button. I have tried shutting eclipse down and starting it back up. What am I missing?

Found it -- I was opening a ShowPath project (which was empty) and then attempting to import it. Open any other workspace (or none), then do the import to go to the imported project.
